Abstract:
Leaf Area Index (LAI) is a dimensionless variable defined as the total one-sided area of green leaves in a vegetation canopy relative to a unit ground area. LAI ignores canopy details such as leaf angle distribution, canopy height or shape. LAI values typically range from 0 for bare ground to 6 or above for a dense forest. Fraction of Photosynthetically Active Radiation absorbed by vegetation (FPAR) is also a dimensionless variable defined as the fraction of the photosynthetically active radiation absorbed by vegetation. FPAR is directly related to the primary productivity function of photosynthesis, and therefore, used to estimate the assimilation of CO2 in vegetation. Both variables are used to calculate surface photosynthesis, evapotranspiration, and net primary production, which help model the terrestrial energy, carbon, and biogeochemical components of vegetation.

In contrast to the Terra-MODIS (MOD15A2), Aqua-MODIS (MYD15A2), and the combined Terra and Aqua MODIS (MCD15A2) versions of the 8-day LAI and FPAR products, the level-4 combined (Terra and Aqua) MODIS global LAI and FPAR product is composited every 4 days at 1-kilometer resolution. Projected on a Sinusoidal grid, the MCD15A3 product includes the following Science Data Sets (SDS): LAI, FPAR, and a set of quality rating, and standard deviation layers for each variable. The increased temporal frequency of the 4-day product helps in monitoring phenology and associated rapid changes (that occur within less than a week) especially during transition periods (green-up and senescence).

V005 Data Set Characteristics:  
Temporal Coverage: July 4, 2002 - March 29, 2017
Area: ~10 degrees x 10 degrees lat/long 
Image Dimensions: 1200 x 1200 rows/columns 
Spatial Resolution: 1 km
File Size: 1.1 MB
Resolution: 1000 meters
Projection: Sinusoidal 
Science Data Sets (SDS HDF Layers): 6

RelatedUrls.Description: Data set landing page at the LP DAAC
Interface to search, discover, and access EOS data products, and invoke available data services.
LP DAAC Data Pool provides direct access to all currently available MODIS products and the ability to download them via HTTP.

The MODIS Reprojection Tool on the Web (MRTWeb) is available for selected MODIS land products.  MRTWebâ€™s capabilities include reprojecting to alternate map projections, spatial and spectral subsetting, resampling, and alternate output format options.

USGS EarthExplorer (EE) provides users the ability to query, search and order archived ASTER and MODIS products available from the LP DAAC.  Registered users of EE have access to additional features than guest users.

The USGS Global Visualization Viewer (GloVis) is an online search and order tool driven by browse images.  Users may select any geographical area of interest (for any given product) and view all available browse images for that area before deciding to order those products.

The Land Processes Distributed Active Archive Center (LP DAAC) is one of several discipline-specific data centers within the NASA Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS).  The LP DAAC Web page provides information about available data products, services, documentation, order interfaces, and tools.
The MODIS Land home page is maintained through NASA's Goddard Space Flight Center and documents various aspects of the land component of the MODIS mission.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: HORIZONTALTILENUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Horizontal tile number of a grid, which increases from left to right.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: NDAYS_COMPOSITED
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Number of days of the data that have been composited.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTGOODQUALITY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels with good quality

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTOTHERQUALITY
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of pixels with not so good quality

AdditionalAttributes.Name: VERTICALTILENUMBER
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Vertical tile number of a grid, which increases from top to bottom.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTGOODFPAR
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Tile-wise % of good or excellent quality FPAR pixels.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTGOODLAI
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Tile-wise % of good or excellent quality LAI pixels.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTEMPIRICALMODEL
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Tile-wise % of FPAR,LAI values calculated using Empirical (732) model method.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: PROCESSVERSION
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Version of the process software that generated the product.

AdditionalAttributes.Name: QAPERCENTMAINMETHOD
AdditionalAttributes.Description: Percent of tile's pixels computed using the Radiative Transfer (main) method vs. the backup empirical LUT method

AdditionalAttributes.Name: TileID
AdditionalAttributes.Description: MODIS Land tile identification number which represents a geographical area on the surface of the Earth bounded by latitude and longitude coordinates.

EntryTitle: MODIS/Terra+Aqua Leaf Area Index/FPAR 4-Day L4 Global 1km SIN Grid V005
